sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"成熟，长成"之意。
means: mature ： 指生物自然发育成熟或丰满或使其能起正常作用，还可指人获得智慧、经验或变得世故。
ripen ： 侧重已到长生成熟的顶点。
age ： 一般指使人过早成熟，强调已走向衰老。
develop ： 侧重使某一种类或个体潜在本能进化完全，词义比mature广泛。

sentence.Network_en: She won a grant to develop her own business.
sentence.Network_cn: 她赢得了一笔拨款，用以扩展自己的企业。

sentence.Network_en: You have to develop your capabilities to the maximum.
We have to develop a less amateurish approach to our organisa-tions.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们必须使我们对待自己组织的态度变得较为专业。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英文面试常见问题和答案 - IT公司面试手册 ... devise 设计，发明 develop 开发，发挥 double 加倍，翻一番.
鼠标吧_百度贴吧 ... RT， 新人求罩 develop 拓 rta，lol。 各种单机.
...定”正确。选项［A］不对，因为social emotions是猴子所天生具有的（末段第一句），谈不上develop（培养）。选项［Ｃ］“动物常常像人类那样公开显示出它们的感情”不正确，篇章中没有明显提出这一方面的信息。选项.
新版新概念第二册　单词表--koflfy ... expert n.专家 develop v.养成 habit n.习惯.

list.abs: 发展(development)，是事物从出生开始的一个进步变化的过程，是事物的不断更新。是指一种连续不断的变化过程。
二开发(development) 1.开发型客户是销售组织的未来潜力。销售组织的基本目标就是将采购组织推入到核心领域。
英语词汇分类(1) - linglong的日志 - 网易博客 ... to develop 显影 developer 显影剂 bath 水洗.

means.word_mean: 生长;成长;发展
进步;进化
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in the sense 'unfold, unfurl'): from French développer, based on Latin dis- 'un-' + a second element of unknown origin found also in envelop

entry.def: When something develops, it grows or changes over a period of time and usually becomes more advanced, complete, or severe.

example.ex: As children develop, some of the most important things they learn have to do with their sense of self...
example.tran: 在成长过程中，孩子学到的一些最重要的东西与他们的自我意识有关。

example.ex: It's hard to say at this stage how the market will develop...
example.tran: 在现阶段，很难说市场将会如何发展。

entry.def: If a problem or difficulty develops, it begins to occur.

example.ex: A huge row has developed about the pollution emanating from a chemical plant.
example.tran: 一家化工厂造成的污染已经引发了激烈争论。

example.ex: ...blood clots in his lungs, a problem which developed from a leg injury.
example.tran: 由腿伤引起的他肺部的血块

entry.tran: (国家从贫穷的农业国向富有的工业国)发展
entry.def: If you say that a country develops, you mean that it changes from being a poor agricultural country to being a rich industrial country.

example.ex: All countries, it was predicted, would develop and develop fast.
example.tran: 据预测，所有国家都会实现发展而且发展速度会很快。

entry.tran: （使）（企业或行业）发展；（使）扩展；（使）壮大
entry.def: If you develop a business or industry, or if it develops, it becomes bigger and more successful.

example.ex: She won a grant to develop her own business...
example.tran: 她赢得了一笔拨款，用以扩展自己的企业。

example.ex: Over the last few years tourism here has developed considerably.
example.tran: 在过去几年里，这里的旅游业获得了相当大的发展。

entry.def: To develop land or property means to make it more profitable, by building houses or factories or by improving the existing buildings.

example.ex: Entrepreneurs developed fashionable restaurants and bars in the area.
example.tran: 实业家在这一地区建起了许多时尚的餐馆和酒吧。

example.ex: ...the cost of acquiring or developing property.
example.tran: 获得或开发地产的成本

entry.tran: 养成(习惯);获得(名声);形成(信仰)
entry.def: If you develop a habit, reputation, or belief, you start to have it and it then becomes stronger or more noticeable.

example.ex: She later developed a taste for expensive nightclubs...
example.tran: 她后来逐渐变得喜欢去消费高昂的夜总会。

example.ex: Mr Robinson has developed the reputation of a ruthless cost-cutter.
example.tran: 大家都知道鲁宾逊先生在降低成本上毫不手软。

entry.def: If you develop a skill, quality, or relationship, or if it develops, it becomes better or stronger.

example.ex: Now you have an opportunity to develop a greater understanding of each other...
example.tran: 现在你们有一个好机会，可以大大增进对彼此的了解。

example.ex: ...weekly workshops that are designed to develop acting and theatre skills...
example.tran: 为了提高表演和舞台技巧而设的每周一次的培训班

entry.def: If you develop an illness, or if it develops, you become affected by it.

example.ex: The test should identify which smokers are most prone to develop lung cancer...
example.tran: 这项检查应该可以确认哪些吸烟者更容易得肺癌。

example.ex: A sharp ache developed in her back muscles.
example.tran: 她后背的肌肉疼得厉害。

entry.def: If a piece of equipment develops a fault, it starts to have the fault.

example.ex: The aircraft made an unscheduled landing after developing an electrical fault.
example.tran: 飞机由于发生电力故障而作了临时降落。

entry.def: If someone develops a new product, they design it and produce it.

example.ex: He claims that several countries have developed nuclear weapons secretly.
example.tran: 他声称有几个国家已经秘密研制出了核武器。

example.ex: ...a computer system specially developed for the Coastguard service.
example.tran: 专为海岸警卫队研发的计算机系统

entry.tran: 阐释(想法、理论、故事或主题)；（使）展开；（使）完善
entry.def: If you develop an idea, theory, story, or theme, or if it develops, it gradually becomes more detailed, advanced, or complex.

example.ex: I would like to thank them for allowing me to develop their original idea...
example.tran: 我想感谢他们允许我深入完善他们最初的想法。

example.ex: This point is developed further at the end of this chapter...
example.tran: 这一点在本章结尾处有进一步阐释。

entry.def: To develop photographs means to make negatives or prints from a photographic film.

example.ex: ...after developing one roll of film.
example.tran: 冲洗了一卷胶卷后

means.word_mean: 1. make something new, such as a product or a mental or artistic creation;

sentences.sentence: "Her company developed a new kind of building material that withstands all kinds of weather"
"They developed a new technique"

means.word_mean: 2. work out;

sentences.sentence: "We have developed a new theory of evolution"

means.word_mean: 3. gain through experience;

sentences.sentence: "I acquired a strong aversion to television"
"Children must develop a sense of right and wrong"
"Dave developed leadership qualities in his new position"
"develop a passion for painting"

means.word_mean: 4. come to have or undergo a change of (physical features and attributes);

sentences.sentence: "He grew a beard"
"The patient developed abdominal pains"
"I got funny spots all over my body"
"Well-developed breasts"

means.word_mean: 5. come into existence; take on form or shape;

sentences.sentence: "A new religious movement originated in that country"
"a love that sprang up from friendship"
"the idea for the book grew out of a short story"
"An interesting phenomenon uprose"

means.word_mean: 6. change the use of and make available or usable;

sentences.sentence: "develop land"
"The country developed its natural resources"
"The remote areas of the country were gradually built up"

means.word_mean: 7. elaborate, as of theories and hypotheses;

sentences.sentence: "Could you develop the ideas in your thesis"

means.word_mean: 8. create by training and teaching;

sentences.sentence: "The old master is training world-class violinists"
"we develop the leaders for the future"

means.word_mean: 9. be gradually disclosed or unfolded; become manifest;

sentences.sentence: "The plot developed slowly";

means.word_mean: 10. grow, progress, unfold, or evolve through a process of evolution, natural growth, differentiation, or a conducive environment;

sentences.sentence: "A flower developed on the branch"
"The country developed into a mighty superpower"
"The embryo develops into a fetus"
"This situation has developed over a long time"

means.word_mean: 11. become technologically advanced;

sentences.sentence: "Many countries in Asia are now developing at a very fast pace"
"Viet Nam is modernizing rapidly"

means.word_mean: 12. cause to grow and differentiate in ways conforming to its natural development;

sentences.sentence: "The perfect climate here develops the grain"
"He developed a new kind of apple"

means.word_mean: 13. generate gradually;

sentences.sentence: "We must develop more potential customers"
"develop a market for the new mobile phone"

means.word_mean: 14. grow emotionally or mature;

sentences.sentence: "The child developed beautifully in her new kindergarten"
"When he spent a summer at camp, the boy grew noticeably and no longer showed some of his old adolescent behavior"

means.word_mean: 15. make visible by means of chemical solutions;

sentences.sentence: "Please develop this roll of film for me"

means.word_mean: 16. superimpose a three-dimensional surface on a plane without stretching, in geometry
17. move one's pieces into strategically more advantageous positions;

sentences.sentence: "Spassky developed quickly"

means.word_mean: 18. move into a strategically more advantageous position;

sentences.sentence: "develop the rook"

means.word_mean: 19. elaborate by the unfolding of a musical idea and by the working out of the rhythmic and harmonic changes in the theme;

sentences.sentence: "develop the melody and change the key"

means.word_mean: 20. happen;

sentences.sentence: "Report the news as it develops"
"These political movements recrudesce from time to time"

means.word_mean: 21. expand in the form of a series;

sentences.sentence: "Develop the function in the following form"

auth_sentence.content: BCC's usually develop in mid to late life.
auth_sentence.res_content: BCC's usually develop in mid to late life.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: BCC's usually develop in mid to late life.

auth_sentence.content: Whether we develop a rivalry remains to be seen.
auth_sentence.res_content: Whether we develop a rivalry remains to be seen.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Whether we develop a rivalry remains to be seen.

auth_sentence.content: How would you like the Sound Index to develop?
auth_sentence.res_content: How would you like the Sound Index to develop?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How would you like the Sound Index to develop?

stems_affixes.word_buile: develop[v.发展, 发达, 发扬]+able能……的→adj.可发展的;可开发的
envelop[n.&v.包封, 遮盖, 包围 n.信封]+e→n.信封；封套
develop[v.发展, 发达, 发扬]+er人→n.开发者
develop[v.发展, 发达, 发扬]+ment表名词→n.发展
en使……+velop包,包裹→包封, 遮盖

stems_affixes.value_cn: 包封, 遮盖, 包围
stems_affixes.word_buile: en使……+velop包,包裹→包封, 遮盖

stems_affixes.value_cn: 发展, 发达, 发扬
stems_affixes.word_buile: de分开+velop包,包裹→把包着的打开→发展, 发达

means.word_mean: 开发, 发展, 壮大

sentences.en: This has made it necessary for agriculture and industry to develop very quickly.
sentences.cn: 这就使得工农业必须飞速发展。

sentences.en: We must do our best to develop the national economy.
sentences.cn: 我们必须努力发展国民经济。

sentences.en: We are developing nuclear weapons to do away with such weapons.
sentences.cn: 我们发展核武器是为了消灭核武器。

means.word_mean: (使)成长, (使)发育, (使)发达

sentences.en: A child develops rapidly between the ages of 13 and 16.
sentences.cn: 孩子在13到16岁之间发育得很快。

sentences.en: Warm rains and summer suns develop the plants.
sentences.cn: 和暖的雨水和夏日的阳光促进植物生长。

means.word_mean: (照相)冲洗, 冲印, 显影, 显像

sentences.en: Can you develop this film for us?
sentences.cn: 你能代我们冲洗这个胶卷吗?

means.word_mean: (开始)患(病)

sentences.en: I developed a cold last week.

means.word_mean: 因而产生，接着产生，接踵而来(from)
【摄影术】显影

sentences.en: With this instant film the picture develops in only one minute.
sentences.cn: 用这种快速胶卷，照片仅用一分钟就会显影。

jushi.english: The relations of friendly cooperation between our two countries are developing satisfactorily.
jushi.chinese: 我们两国的友好合作关系正在令人满意地发展着。

jushi.english: Animal husbandry on the grassland is developing rapidly.
jushi.chinese: 草原上的畜牧业在迅速发展。
